psychotherapy.title: Psychotherapy
psychotherapy.body: A long-term process that helps you gain deeper self-awareness, recognize behavioral patterns, and change them.

consulting.title: Consulting
consulting.body: Short-term support focused on solving specific problems. Helps to overcome crisis situations.

session-reservation.title: Session reservation
session-reservation.body: A convenient way to book your first or follow-up appointment online. Consultations take place in a cozy setting.

aboutme.title: Sandra Jatulytė a psychotherapist
aboutme.about1: I am your psychotherapist, with many years of experience helping people discover inner peace and a deeper understanding of themselves. The essence of my work is to create a safe space where you can openly talk about your experiences and emotions.
aboutme.about2: Your psychotherapist with many years of experience helping people discover inner peace and a deeper understanding of themselves. The essence of my work is to create a safe space.

q1.question: How much does online therapy with „Talkspace“ cost?
q1.answer: „Talkspace“ online therapy costs range from €260 to €396 per month, depending on the selected plan and scope of services. Different packages may include text-based communication, video sessions, or a combination of both. Pricing also varies based on the therapist’s level of experience.

q2.question: Is online therapy truly effective?
q2.answer: Yes, scientific research shows that online therapy is effective for many mental health issues, including anxiety, depression, and stress.

q3.question: How can I find the right therapist for me?
q3.answer: Finding the right therapist starts with assessing your own needs—think about the challenges you're facing and the outcomes you’re hoping for. Look for a qualified professional with experience in your area of concern, and consider their methods, credentials, and licensing.

q4.question: Does online therapy really work?
q4.answer: Some health insurance providers have begun covering online therapy services, but this depends on your specific insurance plan and provider.

q5.question: What’s the difference between therapy and psychiatry?
q5.answer: Therapy (psychotherapy) and psychiatry differ in both educational background and treatment approach. Psychotherapists (such as psychologists or social workers) focus on talk-based methods that help uncover and change patterns in behavior, thinking, and emotions.

q6.question: What’s the best way to choose the right therapist?
q6.answer: Finding the right therapist begins with understanding your personal needs—identify the issues you’re dealing with and the goals you want to achieve. Seek out a qualified specialist experienced in those areas, and review their therapeutic approach, credentials, and licensing.
